010package imagingbook.common.threshold.adaptive;
011
012import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
013import imagingbook.common.threshold.Thresholder;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * Common interface to be implemented by all adaptive (i.e., non-global) thresholders.
018 * See Sec. 9.2 of [1] for an overview.
019 * </p>
020 * <p>
021 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
022 * </p>
023 * 
024 * @author WB
025 * @version 2022/08/01
026 */
027public interface AdaptiveThresholder extends Thresholder {
028        
029        /**
030         * Calculates a adaptive "threshold surface" for the specified
031         * {@link ByteProcessor} and returns it as another {@link ByteProcessor}.
032         * 
033         * @param bp the input image
034         * @return the threshold surface
035         */
036        public ByteProcessor getThreshold(ByteProcessor bp);
037        
038        /**
039         * Thresholds a  {@link ByteProcessor} image by the specified
040         * threshold surface.
041         * 
042         * @param bp the input image (gets modified)
043         * @param Q the threshold surface
044         */
045        public default void threshold(ByteProcessor bp, ByteProcessor Q) {
046                final int w = bp.getWidth();
047                final int h = bp.getHeight();
048                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
049                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
050                                int p = bp.get(u, v);
051                                int q = Q.get(u, v);
052                                bp.set(u, v, (p <= q) ? 0 : 255);
053                        }
054                }
055        }
056        
057        @Override
058        public default boolean threshold(ByteProcessor ip) {
059                ByteProcessor Q = this.getThreshold(ip);
060                if (Q != null) {
061                        this.threshold(ip, Q);
062                        return true;
063                }
064                else {
065                        return false;
066                }
067        }
068
069}
